{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3572149,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-29T11:54:22.619Z","cooked":"

I have our limelight at 1280x800, but the stream res only goes up to 300. Is this a bug or a feature. I’d like to actually see what it sees for field localization to make sure everything is focused. Limelight 3 with 3G lens upgrade BTW.

If you just wanna check focus, I think you can take snapshots at full resolution and use those to adjust.
Streaming is going to be limited, as far as I know.

Frc enforces a 4mb(0.5 MB)ps limit on robot connections. An average 1080p stream needs at the very least 6mbps to work. The limelight has to compete with the Rio to send data as well.

PixL:

Frc enforces a 4mb(0.5 MB)ps limit on robot connections.

Not anymore but LL hasn’t kept up with the changes (now 7 Mbps except as noted for Open Mesh users - thanks for the correction).
FMS Whitepaper — Field Management System Manual 2025.1 documentation.
